website_summaries.verdict: 4-pack of child-safety doorknob covers designed with unique rubber push-buttons for adults to use by grabbing handle.
pros: Constructed of soft polypropylene (PP) and thermoplastic elastomers (TPE), harmless and nontoxic to humans
Simple design in white blends with home décor
Compatible with all standard round doorknobs
Easy to install, no tools or screws required
Push-button grip design makes it easy for adults to use
cons: Functionality seems to depend on size of doorknob
with some knobs, the covers fit too tightly and don't serve their intended purpose

customer_reviews.title: Makes it easier to open the doors
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have abnormally tiny door knobs, these made opening them EASIER for my children, because the rubber on the inside helped grip the knob so when they slightly turned it, it open the doors every time.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if my product is defective, but the ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if my product is defective, but the gripping material sits tightly on the knob and makes it easier for my kids to open doors...defeating the purpose of why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: PN

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted! Newer ones from safety 1st don’t have the area to push in with your thumb and forefinger which makes it difficult to open quickly if your hands are wet. These are perfect
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE. I have been looking for this style door knob covers for a while now. Almost thought I would never find them again. I got some other crappy version from Walmart & my 4yr old was able to break them off. Now that my 2yr old can reach the door locks I was getting very concerned without having proper door knob covers. Had these a couple weeks now & my 4yr old son can't break these off! May need to get more because I almost want them for every door.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of money.  Poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: Worst ever. Don’t waste your money. Took awhile to figure out it was not gripping the doorknob properly because the uneven grips on the inside of the device (see pictures). All four had one properly formed grip while the other was concave and incomplete. It’s like they were injection molded and the molds were incomplete. I find I have to grip extraordinarily hard to be able to turn the knob. My parents cannot operate them due to arthritis. I just threw them out. Can’t even give them away.
customer_reviews.author: I Read Too Many Reviews B4 Buying

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and install
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and received 2 defective ones out of 4. They were defective because they did not line up and click to lock. I received new ones from Amazon and again 2 of 4 were defective. But the ones that did work were great. My 2.5 year old has been getting into rooms and learning to lock doors so this prevents him from being in rooms we don’t want. It’s also very easy to remove and move from door to door if necessary. Just note that it is NOT for front/back doors.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger Mom

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for visiting toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: These take coordination to use and a screwdriver to remove. My niece is 2 and visits us, but does not live here. These are similar to what we used with my son - but improved. He broke the halves apart eventually, but the hinges and improved snap together parts would have prevented that - and saved me from a heart attack too! Prior to these we tried two other kinds, it was nearly impossible to separate the halves, they were too difficult to use with our small door knobs, and we nearly broke them and a doorknob trying to remove them.
customer_reviews.author: Book Addiction

customer_reviews.title: Need the grip strength of a rock climber
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in this. It went on easy enough, but you have to squeeze VERY hard (the plastic is hard, and the grippy is not very good). I am the only one in the house that can routinely open the door, the other adults simply can't grip hard enough. It is kind of like the equivalent of trying to open a door with a bunch of towels wrapped around it, this is how hard you have to squeeze.
customer_reviews.author: Sword

customer_reviews.title: Buy a real door knob cover instead!
customer_reviews.text: This is a China cheapie door knob cover that does not work! On the small side with a bad shape. It did not spin freely on my standard door knob and made it easier to open, as per another review. Don’t let the 4.5 star average fool you. Also easy to squeeze off to remove, and the ‘joints’ are so cheaply made they can break with just pulling it off the knob with my hands (no screw driver required in contrast to the directions.) We are returning immediately. I wish I hadn’t wasted time ordering this, delaying getting a real cover. Now my door will be unsafe for another 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: My son defeated it in 10 seconds
customer_reviews.text: My son spun it around a few times until he realized that he could simply put his thumb in the big gaping front hole & grab the door handle w/ enough friction to open the door. I had high hopes for this device because he defeated the other one w/out the finger grips. I thought this one would be more difficult to overcome. Turns out, it was easier.
customer_reviews.author: Budwick

customer_reviews.title: Hours of enjoyment (for me)
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy watching the boy try and open doors with these attached. Now, instead of having to clean up thrown around q tips, spilled makeup, and things from our pantry... I get to hear him scream and throw an outrageous tantrum because he can't open the door and have his way with various household items. Thanks EUDEMON
customer_reviews.author: Nathan M Weiser

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a particular one of these that I've seen on a door and was particularly easy for adult use. Unfortunately this wasn't like that one though similar. I think it doesn't fit our doorknobs quite right. Turning the lock is nearly impossible and it isn't that easy to turn the knob either. It might work better on a different doorknob. It does keep the kids from opening the door though so it fulfills its function that way.
customer_reviews.author: Ria

customer_reviews.title: I cant enter my bedroom
customer_reviews.text: I was exited to buy this because i notice the my son is trying to open the door. I tried to prevend a possible injury or something. For that reason i bought those lockers. After instaling themy som couldnt open the door. But the problem is that even for me and my wife is hard to open the door. It is very hard to open it. Thats why i took it of. To take it of it took me 30 minutes because it was very complecated. I wouldnt buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: MartinZ18

customer_reviews.title: Are your kids a tornado? This product is for you.
customer_reviews.text: My kids (ages 3 and 1) were constantly going into our master bathroom to destroy things, getting into storage closet to "help" unpacking plastic totes, etc. We call my 1 year old son a tornado because he likes to seek and destroy basically everything in sight. Finally, I gave in and decided to buy this product and it has eased so much of my anxiety about him destroying our house. The installation is super simple. It just clicks over the top of the doorknob. My kids haven't figured out how to get around these, and believe me, they have tried. They come off using a screwdriver and there are instructions included on how to do this.
customer_reviews.author: Aubri Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I ordered 10 of these
customer_reviews.text: We have a very busy toddler who is fully embracing his terrible twos. He is into everything! He loves to trash his sister's room and tries to get his own snacks from the pantry. These fit our door knobs perfectly and were a breeze to install. They are a little difficult to remove, I discovered this when I realized I needed more than the first set of 6 I ordered. I have one on the inside of my son's room so he can't escape in the night. My 6 year old daughter found them tricky to use at first but has no problems now. The company also followed up with me to ensure my satisfaction. Very pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: These works so great at keeping our toddler grandson out of places he should not be or to contain him in a location you want him to stay (like when we are in our finished basement so he does not go upstairs) At first I bought one pack of four and then another and then two more. I think we have them on almost every door in our house! Bathrooms, closets, bedroom doors, basement door, etc. My dog was able to jump up and knock one off the doorknob when I takes me using a screwdriver to pop it off. So far my grandson has not been able to.
customer_reviews.author: Kim K

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if I have abnormally small door handles, but these things were too big and very flimsy. You REALLY had to squeeze hard to get the grippy part to touch the door handle. And it was super long, so it slid forward when you tried to pull the door open. I know the purpose is to make it more difficult for a child to open the doors, but it was even too difficult for the adults. And made it so it required 2 hands to open a door (and when do parents ever have 2 hands free at the same time). Not at all like the ones I remember my parents having when I was a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa McMahon

customer_reviews.title: WORKS!!!  6 year old boy & 2 year old monster cannot enter my room  :)
customer_reviews.text: I Hear the 2 year old outside my room - sometimes for an hour trying to get in. All my internet / computing systems are vulnerable and he would head right to the shiny modem & pull its cord out. Renting space to a friend with 3 children. I'd come home from work to find the 6 year old watching my TV and gaming - drinking my bottle of water lol Now he cannot figure out the simple door mechanism. The 10 year old knows to knock 1st. This Product works miracles!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Takes a Week or So To Get Use To It
customer_reviews.text: It works. It is keeping my 22 month old out of the bathroom... she like to play in the sink and brush her teeth with everyone toothbrush. Lol. Unfortunately, it keeps my 5.5 year old locked out too so I have to go open the door for him whenever he needs to go potty. I need to train him on how to open the door. My 6, 8 and 9 year old God children can open the door which is great. At least I don’t have to go open it for all the kids! It took a couple of weeks for me to get use to it. It definitely works!
customer_reviews.author: Mama Ward

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and keeps toddlers safe
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because the first set of safety door knobs I ordered didn’t fit our door knobs. I was unaware that they weren’t all universal. These fit perfect and are easy for us adults to use. They don’t require much force at all to push down the tabs and open, so much so that my toddler actually figured it out on day 2 of using but he hasn’t figured it out since so it must have been a fluke. These look nice and pretty standard for a safety knob. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: So glad I tried them!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase these knob covers because I already had some that I bought from Walmart a year or so ago, but they didn't work on our round bathroom doorknob. Therefore I was skeptical that these would, but my 4 year old nephew just couldn't stop opening the bathroom door, so I was desperate. Well I'm so glad I ordered them. Upon opening them, I thought they were actually smaller than the ones we already had, but I was wrong. They slipped right on all the knobs I wanted them on. And they were even easier to install than the ones we already had. I am very happy with this purchase and would definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Lo Lo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: These are cheaply made knob covers. They don’t fit my bedroom doorknob since it’s slightly bigger than a regular small door knob. I was able to at least use it for our spare bedroom knob. The material of the plastic feels cheap, and it’s hard to remove. I had to use wire cutters to remove one of the covers.
customer_reviews.author: Clemchao

customer_reviews.title: Do not work when it's humid out
customer_reviews.text: So, this summer, after these performing very well over the winter, I found a bug with them. When the humidity gets over say 50%, these things no longer grip the door knob, no matter how hard you press. Literally, two hands squeezing the buttons to the point where your bones want to break and they still won't grip the door knob. I have to stick a finger into the hole in the front and then use my finger as a makeshift grip. Man it hurts, and my wife can't do it. She literally cannot get out of the front door to go to work in the morning, I have to do it for her.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Senior

customer_reviews.title: Not for All Doorknobs Styles!
customer_reviews.text: These didn't work at all for my doorknobs. Easy to install but once on, the rubber grippers wouldn't work at all to grip the doorknobs, couldn't get doorknobs to turn AT ALL. (Our outside doors have doorknobs that slant down towards base, pic included of style we have). Tried on bathroom door and it kind of worked but was still too difficult for me to turn. Easy to remove with screwdriver tip at least. Returning. These may work for a round globe style knob...idk.
customer_reviews.author: I. Thorpe

customer_reviews.title: Child AND Adult Proof
customer_reviews.text: Well these definitely did their job...my child can no longer unlock and open the front door....and neither can I or my husband (insert 20 laughing emojis here). I think maybe our door knobs are smaller than normal because it’s extremely difficult to open and lock our front door. However on the pantry door it’s easy. I think I might break off the two side grip things so we can actually grab the knob to open the door. As far as locking the knob, we may have to live without doing so (don’t worry we still have dead bolts).
customer_reviews.author: Leila Castillo

customer_reviews.title: The items i received did not work well
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately, the items i received did not work well. of the four, one would not close properly so could not be used. of the three, all worked great for a couple of days, then two would not grab the handle and made it impossible for an adult lest a child to open the door. might just be the ones i received, but i strongly recommend against these since the ones i received could hamper an adult trying to escape the house in an emergency. i took all off and tossed them.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: It’s a no for me.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like these at all. It is very difficult to get the doors to open. The part that you would pinch for an adult to open the door is too slippery. It doesn’t have enough rubber backing to make it possible to grip the door handle. Everyone struggles to open the doors now. If, god forbid, there was a fire or an emergency, it’d be difficult to get out in time! I tried taking these off my door handles, and can’t get them off! 🤦🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Marie

customer_reviews.title: They really, really work!
customer_reviews.text: (TL;DR: they’re fantastic- really easy to install, and don’t pop off easily) I’ve purchased THREE other types of these on Amazon, and they didn’t hold up as well. You’d barely squeeze them, and they would just pop off. My 2 year old Daughter could do it... However, we were desperate for a great pair, and we were recommended these by my Daughter’s dance instructor. I’m glad she mentioned something, because they really, really work! They don’t pop off easily, and are easy to install! I’ve had zero issues now. I’ve had them for a few months now, and couldn’t recommend them more.
customer_reviews.author: Christian White

customer_reviews.title: Only for round knobs. Require a lot of force.
customer_reviews.text: well... they're a challenge for adults as well.. - These will only fit the rounded door knobs. These are a complete waste if you have slightly oblong or ellipsoid or slightly flattened doorknobs. - Even when fitted on the correct doorknobs, these were a bit of a failure because they actually made the doors unusable for adults since they're hard to use and don't grip well once squeezed. - They require a LOT of force to activate.
customer_reviews.author: E!

customer_reviews.title: great for round doir knobs
customer_reviews.text: love those but only if your door knobs are the bulb/round kind. For great and easy to use and open for grown ups, little ones can't open which is exactly the point of it! So hard to remove though, good thing we need it all times so it's OK. If your door knobs are the older cylinder/cone shape, don't even try, you will never be able to get in the room even you as the grown up.. it has no grip and it's not really designed with this shape in mind
customer_reviews.author: Karl K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and worth the peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product once my two year old started wandering the halls by himself at 5am. These are very easy to install. They snap in place and stay put even after being aggressively yanked several times a day. Removing them requires a little bit of effort. Please be advised that while this works great on most doorknobs, you’d have a tougher time gripping smaller doorknobs while this lock is on. It took several days for me to learn that
customer_reviews.author: MommyOfTwo

customer_reviews.title: A great buy
customer_reviews.text: These serve their purpose very well. I thought they were flimsy when I took it out of the bag and had a little trouble getting it to close over the knob but once it was on,it was perfect! My son is 6 with Autism and he loves to go outside along with his 2 year old brother following him wherever he goes so anxiety attacks were constant. At least now,I can breathe. My son gave up trying to open the door and waits patiently for us to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Cordero

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit our door handle
customer_reviews.text: Tried using this on a newer door handle (we live in a half refurbished old home) and the cover was too tight and could be opened without pressing on the side pieces. It was useless because my son could easily open the door with it still on. I put it on an older door handle from the 1950s and the handle was smaller so the cover spins around and you have to press the side pieces to grab the handle and open the door. So it is useless on half our doors!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for our knobs
customer_reviews.text: These were the second set of knob covers I tried at our house. I’m trying to accomplish two things: prevent my kids from walking out the front door AND keep my toddler out of his brother’s room. These worked great on our front door but didn’t fit on our interior doors. I guess our knobs are more bulbous because these covers fit snugly around them and actually make a doorknob EASIER to turn. I’ll have to come up with another solution.
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not good hurting my hands
customer_reviews.text: Yes it is safe for kids as it is hard to figure out how to open it, but since I bought it my fingers and hands have been hurting. If you not hold it properly and press it, it hurts your main fingers a lot. Also if you have small hands (ladies S size) it is too big to hold and twist. For kids it is good, it works for them. In the darkness, it can be quite challenging to find where you need to press to open it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not suitable for our doorknobs. The covers are way too loose and you can spin them around which doesn’t allow you to grip them. This issue also made it harder to put them in the knobs and to lock. I’d your doorknobs are bigger than ours, they will probably work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: akaziggy

customer_reviews.title: ANOTHER LAYER OF SAFETY
customer_reviews.text: The grand children spend much time with us. The 2 year old had learned how to open doors but not the concept that opening the front door and going outside as being dangerous...or that playing in a bathroom is not the best choice. Now, I don't worry that we will wake up to find the door open and child missing. The door knob covers give us an extra layer of security until the child learns how to manipulate them, but that we will face another day.
customer_reviews.author: marty d

customer_reviews.title: Hard for adults to open
customer_reviews.text: My older Kids and I have a difficult time opening doors with these on them. I think because our door knobs are small the device has a hard time gripping it. I've had some others that are just open holes on the side so you can actually grip the door knob. Those are quite a bit easier to use than this type. They do clip on the knob securely and my 2 year old has never been able to open a door or take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Reuter

customer_reviews.title: Fits too snug and toddler instantly opened the door
customer_reviews.text: Nope. Installed the first one on our generic front door knob...I had my 22 month old test it out and almost instantly was able to open the door. You do not have to squeeze it to open the door. It fits too snugly to the knob and basically grips the knob and is not lose at all. I bought this MAINLY for the front door, and it did not work out for what we needed it for. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: easy and safe
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for my mom who has Alzheimer's. She was opening doors and taking off. This has stopped her leaving without our knowing. This cover is great because I can get a grip on the door knob. However, my dad who is 92 isn't able to turn knob. Maybe he doesn't have a strong grip. He just can't turn the door knob. So, I have to go back to the old safety cover that we had. I do recommend this one though! I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very small covers
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately these door knob covers run on the small side so they only actually work on one of the door knobs that I got them for. On the other knobs they fit pretty snugly and so it’s easy for my daughter to still open the door. If we were not under lockdown right now I would definitely return them. The knob covers I’ve seen before are much larger than these. Wish I had known the size before ordering! Otherwise they seem fine though, so if you have very small doorknobs they should still work.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Forte

customer_reviews.title: Product for peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product that is easy to install. Little hands can not grasp the buttons to open the door, but it is relatively easy for adults to use. Peace of mind for parents and grandparents of adventurous toddlers! A must for every home. As little ones grow, they are tempted to climb out of their beds and wander. Put one on your bathroom doors or doors that lead outside!
customer_reviews.author: Bargain shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Does the trick. My almost 2yo is usually unable to get doors to open, thanks to these; however, she tries often and occasionally finds the right grip to do it. So it’s not completely toddler prooof, but it’s definitely helped.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: My kid broke all 4 the same way once he figured out how
customer_reviews.text: All they need to do is hook a finger in the hole at the end and pull down. Doesn't even take much weight, just one hand. Snaps the flimsy little hinge pins right off. The moment he figured out how to do this the first time, he did it to the other 3 pairs almost just as soon as I put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy external doors
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use on the inside of our front & back doors as well as a couple of interior room doors. These work okay on the lighter interior doors, but would not work for our heavier front & back doors. I believe it is because the rubber grip pads that squeeze against the knob aren't big &/or strong enough to grip the knobs enough to turn it on heavier doors. Too bad. Went in the trash. Also, these were a bit of a pain in the butt to remove. Had to damage them to remove them.
customer_reviews.author: Booce

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's designed for. They are not easy to remove ( we only leave them on when the grandson is here) but they are fine. If you have arthritis in your hands, they can be a little difficult to squeeze to open the door
customer_reviews.author: sllimb

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on, but then doesn’t grip the door right enough to get out myself. We had to cut the grips off, and then it just became a pain. Fortunately these work for the insides of my kids rooms so they can’t escape at night but if I get shut in there I’d be in trouble. I also had a horrible time removing and could only remove by damaging it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bough this because my 2 year old stared learning how to open the doors around the house and let me tell you this is perfect !!!! She is not able to open the door anymore its very easy to instal and very easy to remove as well. I totally recommend this to all the parents out there that have a toddle that are staring to lean how to open the door around you're home. Its safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Saved my Snacks
customer_reviews.text: I love this, my two year old had a habit of opening the door leading into the garage and I was so afraid that she would hurt herself, so I went and bought some door safety locks from the dollar tree and it worked for a day and then my three year old realized that she could pull it apart and then she is able to open the door, which for her was the pantry to try and take snacks. So I bought this and it has worked so well, my three year old can’t break it much to her chagrin. So now both my two year old and the snacks are safe.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee

customer_reviews.title: Tricky but does the job
customer_reviews.text: They were a litttle tricky to get the locking tabs to line up while the device was around the door knob. I was able to do it easily when the device wasnt nk on the door knob, so I do not consider it a defect. I think the angle just made it tricky. However, all of the devices are on my doors now and I am very pleased. My little one is getting close to figuring out door knobs and this should keep her from encounting dangerous situations.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for this style as I hate the new kind that you can find everywhere. I was thrilled to find these. I absolutely love them. We have a 3-1/2 yr old grandson and these are a MUST, esp now that he knows how to unlock doors and open them. Easy for adults to open, but toddlers can't. We ended up ordering another package of them. You will not be disappointed with these.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Gatley

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind!
customer_reviews.text: This product is AWESOME! Simple yet effective! It prevented my 2 grandsons from exiting the kitchen, patio and front doors. It was so effective I used the 4th on the pantry door they enjoyed venturing into frequently. These simple and effective covers made the visit so much more relaxing for both parents and grandparents. These covers are a MUST for those wanting peace of mind!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old can still open the doors
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 packages and 1 lock actually works as intended and 1 lock actually prevented me to being able to open a door so I had to take it off. All the rest just don't fit over our door knobs to where it can twist around it. I think the knobs catch the rubber part inside and you can open the door normally, so they are of no use for us.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Mary

customer_reviews.title: Too easy to crack by little kid
customer_reviews.text: The idea sounds right -- have a special place where only adult can press to make the knob turn. The reality is -- this product does not work. Reason 1. material, it is made of rubber. It is soft and sticky. Will very little pressure the cover is full contact with the knob. 2. size. It is made too tight. It is very easy for kid to press the cover a bit to engage the knob.
customer_reviews.author: F Tan

customer_reviews.title: Better than the normal kind
customer_reviews.text: I like this kind way better than the kind with the holes on the side where you can still touch the door knob. I have caught my fingers in those and it hurts and they are also harder to open. When I first tried these I was amazed at how easy it was for me to open the door. I don’t think a child would be able to open it though because they have to know to push on the gray parts on both sides and their hands aren’t usually big enough to do that. So far my 2.5 yr old hasn’t been able to get doors open with them.
customer_reviews.author: bunzizzle

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my boys in the house!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is more terrifying than when you're changing you're baby's dirty diaper, and you're 4 year old proceeds to unlock and open the front door. This has fixed it. They were a snap (literally) to install, and easy for the adults to use. Even my smarter-than-the-average-bear 4 year old can't figure it out. I'm going to buy more for a few more rooms in the house that are off limits (craft room, attic, etc). I'm happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kbish

customer_reviews.title: Stops kids and some adults
customer_reviews.text: Our youngest is a determined seeker who started breaking in/out everything (cabinets, fridge, multiple baby gates) and getting into mayhem in the bathrooms and bedrooms when unattended. Our biggest fear was him escaping the house since we know he's a runner. We placed these on the bathrooms and the garage doors and it's the only lock mechanism he hasn't been able to get past yet.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Jay

customer_reviews.title: The extra few dollars are worth it for ease of opening
customer_reviews.text: We had previously used other door knob covers, and even adults had a hard time getting their fingers in the holes to open the door. These have grip spots on them which make opening the door much easier. That being said, my 4yo can open them as well. This isn't an issue for us as it is to prevent our younger child who cannot grip them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed on every level.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a product that would keep knob from locking accidentally. Didn't fit any of my doorknobs; too loose. Tried it anyway. When door opened, it hit wall and broke apart. Ever the optimist, I tried again. Door locked when touched the wall. Repeated attempts to remove product per instructions failed. Looks like I'll have to cut it off.
customer_reviews.author: Marne Burke

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This past weekend my two year old learned how to open every door in our house. I knew that for the sake of my sanity I needed to move quickly to remedy this situation and I went to my go to place - Amazon! I I searched my options and this company offered a good price and quick delivery with Prime. I have the covers by Monday afternoon and on my doors Monday evening...much to my toddler's frustration. The covers were easy to put on and required no tools.
customer_reviews.author: MOConnor 21

customer_reviews.title: Makes it EASIER to open our doors...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be designed for very small door knobs. The rubber on the inside of the child lock grips our door knobs so we'll that the doors are actually easier to open with the child lock installed. We had previously used a similar design, but with openings instead of rubber buttons on it. I'll have to return these and look around for something different.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cermak Jr

customer_reviews.title: Check the size of your door knobs.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to keep my 1 1/2 year old out of certain areas of our home. They were easy to install but are very hard to remove. One of our door knobs is bigger than the others and the devices fits tighter on it. My son can open this open because the device fits it so tightly. But it has worked great on all the other door knobs. So definitely check the size of your door knobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought the “Safety first” door knob covers at first, and we as adults couldn’t even open the door with them on. They also didn’t fit properly over all our doorknobs. This brand is higher quality, secure, fits all our door knobs and adults can get in and out. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: AMH

customer_reviews.title: Good BUT...........
customer_reviews.text: Would have given this 5 stars but the pieces don't stay together well. The description says it's an easy take off by popping it open with a screwdriver but that's not even needed since they pop open as soon as you touch the doorknob. I ended up having to use a little bit of glue to hold them together.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Good but for younger kids probably
customer_reviews.text: These are great in theory, a lot easier to use than my daycares fully plastic ones. However there's a down side of the rubber and being easier to use, they fit a bit tight on my standard sized doorknobs and my 3 year old was able to open them without much problem. Back to square one.
customer_reviews.author: Kat K.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: These do the trick! They are a bit large and loose on our antique crystal door knobs, but they work perfectly. Our four year old has stopped opening and slamming his door over and over again every night. The peace is priceless! Once we’re sure he’s forgotten that habit, we can easily remove the cover and move on with our lives.
customer_reviews.author: in_a_bell_jar

customer_reviews.title: These things suck
customer_reviews.text: You have to have abnormally small door knobs for these to work. We have regular knobs and these fit very tightly so you don't even have to use the gray grips to open doors. My 20 month old can mess with them and get doors open without issue. They're completely useless for us.
customer_reviews.author: gwynromero

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: My kids were escaping their room every night, and it was really worrying me then it occurred to me that these were probably the answer. Once I took a good look at how the two sides fit together, it was extremely easy to install. Our house is 30 years old with 30 year old doors and hardware, so the covers are a little large and making it a bit difficult for adults to squeeze and and twist the knob.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are hideous but they work
customer_reviews.text: They work for now my son and father and all dogs are locked in the house for good moohoohoohahaha but in other news they are super ugly so this is a functionality over esthetics kinda thing and measure your doorknobs to make sure they fit cuz that seems to be an issue with alot of other buyers
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B.

customer_reviews.title: If you have kids, you need this!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and as intended to keep my toddlers out of (or in) places where they don’t or do belong. My 3 year old was able to unlock the door and twist the knob by its side and going outside on his own before getting this product. Now he’s not able to do it anymore without parental supervision.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Effective.
customer_reviews.text: They have worked really well for over a year for us. They snap over the door handles well and prevent my 2-3 yo daughter from opening the door. My wife can lock the handle well, but is a little bit of a struggle for me. Wouldn’t say that they are the highest quality made, but have held up for over the year and would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: G. K.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for newer style door knobs
customer_reviews.text: This would be better for Older door knobs that are smaller in profile , the newer style door knobs are too wide and the little press buttons on the side are to recessed making Them in affective, Therefore I had to heat them up and pull the recessed buttons out to get them to kind of work. Great concept not the best execution.
customer_reviews.author: Ton

customer_reviews.title: Do not like these at all
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy, highly do not recommend these! We ADULTS have the hardest time opening the door with these locks. We have similar brands we have on other door knobs in the house but these are absolutely terrible. We’ve replaced them with a better brand that we find easier to use
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on standard knobs.
customer_reviews.text: So - if you're looking for covers that will keep a toddler out, these do the job. But if you're looking for covers that function on doors that you use frequently - don't buy these. They are FAR too loose on our door knobs, requiring a significant amount of pressure (I had to use both hands) to open a door. Even then it took more than one try. I had this on our front door and took it off almost immediately - if I needed to open the door quickly these would be a hazard. It was also an effort to install - the littler tabs don't easily click into place. Returning and looking for something that's a better. fit.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for kids & adults
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my dad who has Alzheimer’s. He lives with me and was constantly opening the doors and going outside. He is unable to be outside unsupervised and I was alway fretting about him sneaking out. Problem solved these work perfect & I can hear him when he is trying to figure out how to get outside now. Very well made only drawback is they are difficult to take off which is good for him but not for me:)
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: These are for the world's smallest doorknobs--DO NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what sized doorknob these are supposed to fit, but they definitely did not fit mine. Our doorknobs are average size if not a little on the small side. However, when you click the lock into place, it actually made it easier to grip the doorknob and open. Then I thought maybe I'll only tighten one side so that they're loose? It took my two-year-old 3 minutes to pry them off and wander out of his room. I will not be keeping these.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Only works 1/2 the time
customer_reviews.text: The grippers don’t always grip. 2 out of for I ended up having to remove because we couldn’t open the doors. The other 2 are fine. I don’t know what the difference is because they’re all the exact same door knob. But 2 would not grip the knob to open it, just spun round and round.
customer_reviews.author: M.Rawls

customer_reviews.title: Depends on the door knob
customer_reviews.text: these work great...on some of my knobs. 2 of my knobs are a little tougher the other to turn (guessing because they're older) and I don't think the rubber grips are strong enough for those knobs. But the knobs that turn smoother....I like these covers better than the ones with the holes your fingers go into.
customer_reviews.author: MommaBee

customer_reviews.title: Use double sided tape
customer_reviews.text: It works at keeping the kiddos out, but also works at keeping mommies and daddies out too. They work well on some door knobs, but a couple doors I had to use double sided tape on the knobs to get them to grab. If you already have them.. that’s a cheap solution. If you don’t... find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Scott

customer_reviews.title: These fit snuggly, and that can be a problem.
customer_reviews.text: Theses knob locks are great, but my 4-year-old conquered them in a day by just smashing her hands together to get a grip on the knob. Still has my 2-year-old confused, but I assume its just a matter of time. The issue is almost any amount of pressure disables them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Childproof Door Knob Covers
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product, installs & removes nicely and would be very, very hard or impossible for a young child to turn the knob to open the door; however, it did not fit our door knobs very well. Once they were on, we would have to remove them to lock or unlock the door. It would definitely work good on the correct-sized door knobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my worst nightmare came true, my toddler waddled our the front door because he newly discovered how to unlock doors. I have small door handles so unless you push the two “grips” together it’ll just spin around in place. It’s detoured my toddler so far. He doesn’t seem to even care about the door anymore because he can’t turn the knob and that’s what I wanted. Overall a great product for small door handles.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Schlumper

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: These work well to deter my 22 month old toddler from getting out of her room at night. They are easy enough for me and my husband to open. The only downside is that our doorknob is on the smaller side, so the cover hangs down instead of sitting straight. Not a big deal but it doesn't look as nice.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Kid won't open doors!
customer_reviews.text: These were so easy to take out of the packaging and just put on my doorknobs. Barely read the directions, just glanced at it. Had 3 on doorknobs within minutes and now I feel better knowing my toddler can't open the doors. My 7 year old nephew couldn't open the bathroom door either, had to do it for him. So they work!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Rodeheaver

customer_reviews.title: Works great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to keep my daughter from opening the doors to the steps and bathroom. They definitely work although if you’re in a rush it can be a little annoying trying to grip the door the right way to open it. I expected that though and so it doesn’t reflect negatively on the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mollie Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Beware doorknob size
customer_reviews.text: For my front door it's a little big but does the job. I cant use it on my bedroom door because the fit is weird. I got locked in my room because it was on so tight and the grips didnt reach the doorknob. Mainly I need to keep my son safe from going outside alone and that is covered. They do the job pending doorknob size.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Our bedrooms are safe from little mischief-makers :)
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I bought them because of the good reviews and was eager to try them out to keep our 3-yr-old twins out of the older kids' rooms. As soon as I installed the first one, the little guy was trying to get into the girls' room but couldn't. It was pretty comical seeing how well these things work. The next day, I wanted more so I went to the store and got the only brand they had. We definitely prefer these because of the texture of the plastic and the little squeezy tabs that help the big people with opening the door.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Wall

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed to replace our others!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Our 2 year old learned how to remove our other, similar ones, and we were having issues with him running outside since he knows how to unlock the deadbolt. With the old ones, we also had issues with our 4 year old being unable to open doors, like the bathroom door, by himself. These locks don’t just pop off like the others, and they have a better grip making for less close potty calls for our older kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: AKens

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for about two months (?).... not long; but, long enough to know they are not something I’d recommend. They keep the babies but, we have to actually remove them to open the doors ourselves. That’s not how it’s supposed to work. .
customer_reviews.author: Linda/Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Can't lock and unlock door with this on the knob ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't lock and unlock door with this on the knob. It is too deep, so it creates a gap between the lock and the hole and we can't reach our fingers in.
customer_reviews.author: NJDMS

customer_reviews.title: Newer Knobs Only
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for the door knobs you buy now from Home Depot/Lowes. Easy enough to put together, a head scratch or two and then you'll open it back up. This is definitely not for any antique or classic doors/knobs. Still works nonetheless!
customer_reviews.author: Row Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy About This Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I bought a pack and came back and bought some more! They fit all of our door knobs perfectly!! They are super easy to install and use. They can be a little harder to pop off, but that doesn’t bother me. I like that I don’t have to worry about them falling off!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Child... shall not... pass!
customer_reviews.text: They work so well that even adults have had issues using them. If an adult can't use it, there is no way a kid will be able to. We have them on both traditional and glass handles and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Lesa

customer_reviews.title: Help I cant get out!
customer_reviews.text: I got these today to prevent my father with dementia from opening the house door, but now i cant get out either. Ive been pressing the buttons to turn knob but they dont turn knob all the way they actually slip. So now I'm going to have to take the cover off. I wanted to safeguard my dad but now I'm a prisoner smh.
customer_reviews.author: datbkmami

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and very easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a different brand that did not fit our standard door knobs. No idea why. These fit perfectly, extremely easy to install and my, too smart for his own good 2 year old, can’t figure out how to operate the door knob now. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JohnsonPartyofFive

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install easy for adults to open hard for children
customer_reviews.text: My sister-in-law moved in with her two&3 year-olds and so we had to hurry up and baby proof the house my youngest is 13 I like the upgrade that made sense my 13-year-old was a toddler they were easy to install and the door knobs and with a little grippers and make it a lot easier to open the door but hard for the little guys to get them open
customer_reviews.author: Kat702

customer_reviews.title: Allright
customer_reviews.text: These fit great in our bedroom and other door , easy for adults to open, but not so great for the front door as the doorknob is smaller.its very difficult for adults to open . So it depends on your knobs. Either way my kid is unable to open so it does the job
customer_reviews.author: Shriya

customer_reviews.title: Keeps toddler out, easy for mom to open.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to pop on and easy to open doors as an adult and impossible for my son so far. We love them, have them on all the doors to rooms the toddler shouldn't be in. I definitely reccomend these over other styles. I have tried others and these are by far the easiest to use. You don't want to be fiddling with every door you try to open in your house a million times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Wick

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a very smart puppy, with long legs, that learned how to open the door and run out. His latest trick is flipping the deadbolt and locking me out - so far the door knob locks have out lasted him. No cracks or breaks and he can no longer escape.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: My almost 2 year old daughter is an escape artist extreme and compared to the crappy hard plastic door knob covers, these ones exceeded expectations. It’s easy for the adults to use and even our 10 year old is happy about them because his little sister would very frequently storm his room and ransack the place. Also a huge plus for me is that since they aren’t the super hard shiny plastic, they aren’t as loud and don’t continuously spin and clank around when being messed with. I am very satisfied with this product and will be buying another set to replace the others I bought to try out from our local superstore.
customer_reviews.author: Lsoliz

product_meta.title: EUDEMON 4 Pack Baby Safety Door Knob Covers Door Knob Locks
feature_bullets: ★Special Design---Special double button design with soft TPR material increased friction with the door knob. When you need to open the door,press the double buttons and turn the door knob easily.

★Easy Installation/Release---No drill and tools need,no harm to the door.Take off the door knob cover then set it on the door knob and close the two covers,the door knob is in lock.It can be easily released by a screwdriver.

★Why need it---Prevent babies from opening the door and getting into dangers like the toilet or the storeroom and get injured;Prevent babies from going in or out of the house without adults' superision; Prevent children from playing with the door and pinching their fingers.

★Safety & Eco-Friendly---Made of Eco-Friendly PP and TPR material. EUDEMON baby safty door knob cover has pass Mechanical and Physical Properties test(EN71). Parents can use them safely on the door knobs.

Please note that this product has been updated, with only a little difference in appearance, but no change in function. You may receive products both in old version and the new version, but the function is completely the same, please feel free to purchase.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,135 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
